intro: Helictochloa adsurgens, commonly known as the ascending helictochloa, is a grass species native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its inflorescence consists of a single, erect spikelet that bears small, spikelet-like flowers. Helictochloa adsurgens is adapted to arid and semi-arid conditions, demonstrating resilience to drought and poor soil conditions.
